docs.lead_paragraph: Looking beyond America's post-9/11 wars, Defense Secretary Chuck Hagel on Monday proposed shrinking the Army to its smallest size in 74 years, closing bases and reshaping forces to confront a "more volatile, more unpredictable" world with a more nimble military.

headline.main: Hagel Says US Military Must Shrink to Face New Era
headline.print_headline: Hagel Says US Military Must Shrink to Face New Era

docs.lead_paragraph: Arkansas lawmakers will try once again this week to provide funding for the state's Private Option medical insurance plan that has drawn interest from lawmakers in other states as an alternative to Obamacare.

headline.main: Arkansas Lawmakers to Vote on Funds for Alternative to Obamacare
headline.print_headline: Arkansas Lawmakers to Vote on Funds for Alternative to Obamacare

docs.snippet: Arkansas lawmakers will try once again this week to provide funding for the state's Private Option medical insurance plan that has drawn interest from lawmakers in other states as an alternative to Obamacare.

docs.lead_paragraph: Barmer GEK, Germany's largest statutory health insurance provider, is slashing 3,500 jobs, or 20 percent of total staff, in response to deteriorating market conditions and changes in client behaviour.

headline.main: Germany's Biggest Health Insurer to Cut 3,500 Jobs
headline.print_headline: Germany's Biggest Health Insurer to Cut 3,500 Jobs

docs.snippet: Barmer GEK, Germany's largest statutory health insurance provider, is slashing 3,500 jobs, or 20 percent of total staff, in response to deteriorating market conditions and changes in client behaviour.

docs.lead_paragraph: Democrat Mary Landrieu's quest for a fourth Senate term will turn on whether she can attract just enough support from independents and Republicans to win in this increasingly conservative state.

headline.main: La.'s Landrieu Looks for Independent, GOP Support
headline.print_headline: La.'s Landrieu Looks for Independent, GOP Support

docs.snippet: Democrat Mary Landrieu's quest for a fourth Senate term will turn on whether she can attract just enough support from independents and Republicans to win in this increasingly conservative state.

docs.lead_paragraph: House Republicans intent on highlighting the woes of President Barack Obama's health care law need to look no further than their own back yards, some of which are traditionally liberal strongholds.

headline.main: GOP Seizes on State Woes to Highlight Health Care
headline.print_headline: GOP Seizes on State Woes to Highlight Health Care

docs.snippet: House Republicans intent on highlighting the woes of President Barack Obama's health care law need to look no further than their own back yards, some of which are traditionally liberal strongholds.

headline.main: Local Policies That Work for Workers

docs.abstract: Years of effort to improve wages and working conditions on the local and state levels are beginning to pay off, an economist writes.
docs.snippet: Years of effort to improve wages and working conditions on the local and state levels are beginning to pay off, an economist writes.

headline.main: Progress Against Hepatitis C, a Sneaky Virus

docs.abstract: Hepatitis C can go undiagnosed for decades, sometimes becoming evident only after liver damage has already occurred. But there is good news on the pharmaceutical front.
docs.snippet: Hepatitis C can go undiagnosed for decades, sometimes becoming evident only after liver damage has already occurred. But there is good news on the pharmaceutical front.

docs.lead_paragraph: Defense Secretary Chuck Hagel’s budget proposal would eliminate an entire class of Air Force attack jets and scale back the size of the Army not just to pre-9/11 levels, but to the force’s size in 1940.

headline.main: Pentagon Plans to Shrink Army to Pre-World War II Level
headline.print_headline: Pentagon Plans to Shrink Army to Prewar Level

docs.abstract: Defense Sec Chuck Hagel, in new spending proposal, plans to shrink United States Army to its smallest force since 1940 and eliminate entire class of Air Force attack jets; officials describe proposal as first Pentagon budget to aggressively push military off war footing adopted after terror attacks of 2001; critics in Congress vow to use legislative action to block proposed cuts in programs and personnel.
docs.snippet: Defense Secretary Chuck Hagel’s budget proposal would eliminate an entire class of Air Force attack jets and scale back the size of the Army not just to pre-9/11 levels, but to the force’s size in 1940.

byline.original: By THOM SHANKER and HELENE COOPER

docs.lead_paragraph: When bad things happen to imaginary people.
docs.abstract: Paul Krugman Op-Ed column explains how examples highlighted by conservatives of the harm the health care reform has done to people are imaginary; contends the inability to come up with real cases of hardship created by the law is because the true losers are either very affluent people or moderately well-off young men, groups that are not particularly sympathetic.
docs.snippet: When bad things happen to imaginary people.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: Injury claims, government data and public records of oil field accidents since the start of the onshore drilling and fracking boom in 2007 show the federal government failed to implement safety standards and procedures, according to a Houston Chronicle investigation.

headline.main: Newspaper Investigation Questions Oil Field Safety
headline.print_headline: Newspaper Investigation Questions Oil Field Safety
